summary: The "Improving Care and Access to Nurses Act" (I CAN Act) aims to expand access to healthcare services provided by advanced practice registered nurses (APRNs) under Medicare and Medicaid. It removes barriers to practice for Nurse Practitioners, Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs), and Certified Nurse-Midwives, including streamlining care delivery, clarifying reimbursement, and expanding access to training and services. The bill also revises the local coverage determination process and addresses locum tenens for APRNs.
